name: Courtyard Sandestin at Grand Boulevard

reviews.text: Okay, I hate to post a negative review. But I just have to set the record strait here, seeing how this hotel comes in at the top of the list. ?????
reviews.title: Okay, but NOT the #1 or #2 hotel Families be aware.....

reviews.text: First thing I noticed is that the 'attractiveness' factor of our room was NON existant. NO thought to interior design, at all. I am talking an awful camel/orangey carpet... No nice drapes, just sheers that are also that awful camel/orangey color. everything in the room was this color. An awful monochromatic presentation. Even the light wood of the furnishings and wood tables, mini closet, etc... was a light wood with that camel/orange cast. It was simply NOT interior designed to be attractive or visually pleasing at all.

reviews.text: We were very tired; it had been a long day. We drove up & down Panama City Beach stopping in various hotels - but none of them felt 'right'. In spite of our fatigue we decided to continue towards Destin - and we were sooo pleased that we did. The Courtyard Marriott Sandestin was a soothing oasis. The young man at the desk was extremely pleasant and accommodating. The entire hotel is very clean - rooms are large & the beds are just what a tired traveler needs. The common space in the lobby is clean & inviting (& contains a computer with internet access if you don't have your own laptop). We used the free shuttle to eat at Mitchell's Fish House (food was wonderful & female bartender made fab drinks) - lovely evening so we walked back (it is not a long walk). Our plan was to drive to Pensacola the next day, however, we were enjoying our respite too much so stayed another night. Did some shopping at Grand Boulevard Shops - drove around the Sandestin properties & ate at the Bayfront Wharf & checked out some of the shops there. We are usually not fans of 'planned' communities / resorts but have to say that Sandestin seems to do it right - the place felt real & comfortable rather than planned & programmed. The grounds of the resort are gorgeous & perfectly manicured; staff everywhere were pleasant; good selection of shops & restaurants.
reviews.title: An Oasis

reviews.text: The staff at the Courtyard Sandestin go out of their way to help.

Not crowded at all and very nice.
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at this Courtyard the weekend before Thanksgiving. The hotel was empty (i.e. parking galore, free room upgrade, etc...) but this was due to the time of year we visited (off season). Our room was large and very clean. The staff we encountered were polite and cheerfull. It was a really nice experience overall.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As stated in previous posts, this hotel is not located on any body of water but Sandestin does offer shuttle service to the beach, the bay, Baytowne Wharf and the other resort amenities.
reviews.title: GREAT!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.text: We will definately stay here again.
reviews.title: AWESOME

reviews.text: I've never wrote a review before but after reading all of these and then having gone and had a great time , I felt I should. The hotel was so nice, clean, the staff very helpful. We checked in early and they gave us a beautiful view overlooking the pool. We also did late check out. One piece of advice you might want to rent a car. We didn't but would next time. As far as the Hotel it was GREAT!!
reviews.title: OK business hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is incredible! The rooms are large, well-decorated, and clean. The front lobby staff are friendly. You have access to Baytowne Wharf and the private beach. A shuttle is available for both or you can drive. Everything was first-class. We stayed here after staying at JW Marriott Grande Lakes and the room was much better here; cleaner, too! GREAT STAY!
reviews.title: NIce hotel, near beach but not on it.

reviews.text: I actually booked this room through Priceline - maybe that's why i didn't receive any requests such as a balcony or pool view room. I was told there were none available. However, there were rooms with no lights on - i feel like they were open.
reviews.title: Just OK!
Would not stay here again......
reviews.text: Anyway - my first time in Sandestin was enjoyable. This hotel is very easy to find and get in & out of. Extremely SLOW elevator - take the stairs if you're going down... I wish they had a refrigerator - only a "chiller". The room was kind of tight for just the three of us. Just not laid out real well. BUT, it was clean - no complaints there. The breakfast was a joke - way overpriced - go down the road to waffle house.
However, the pool was great - 5 yrd old loved it. The hot tub was so hot you could hardly stand to put your leg in it - dont know what was up with that.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel. Doesn't deserve the cranky reviews.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pretty good hotel - I've had better. You did get the parking pass to go back into the Baytown Wharf & private beach - that was cool. If you are going to go to the beach - GO EARLY or you will have to park way the heck away from the beach - way to far to drag your stuff.
reviews.title: Worst experience I have had with hotel in years. Going down hill.
Nice sand, Sub-Par hotels
reviews.text: We went to Destin for a little R&R for a 2 night stay. I was very disappointed with this hotel, not up to Marriott standards. The rooms carpet was filthy, after the maid came in next day (around 4 pm!) we found sand in both of the beds that night! Really weird since we sure didnt get it there!! We had called because the maid hadnt come by 3:30 pm... maybe she was mad?! The tram service to the beach can be a long wait, better to drive yourself over there. You can park easily especially if you go early. Breakfast at the hotel was just ok, overpriced at 11.00 per person. Would not stay here again..

Corporate travelers will benefit from the new lobby that is designed to give guests the flexibility to work and socialize on their terms. New enhancements to our Destin, Florida, hotel include a contemporary lobby, flexible seating to fit individual or group needs, complimentary Wi-Fi, private media booths and, our new signature element, the touch screen with GoBoard® technology for information on the go. Introducing one of the newest restaurants among hotels in Destin, Florida, The Bistro offers breakfast, lunch and dinner with refreshing, high quality and healthy menu options. "Eat, Drink, and Connect"™ with friends and colleagues for a value that simply cannot be beat. Explore our Destin, FL, hotel's enchanting surroundings consisting of beaches, running and walking trails, state parks, championship golf courses and tennis courts. We invite you to work and relax at Courtyard Sandestin at Grand Boulevard.
